top_categories.workout_context: Race-pace efforts that mimic Finnish Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before August.
At mile 60 of 110, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Finnish Gravel's Well-maintained gravel roads, Forest paths forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 110 miles.
When someone attacks on fast-rolling Finnish gravel roads through UNESCO, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Finnish Gravel's fast-rolling Finnish gravel roads through UNESCO rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Finnish Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
2-minute all-out efforts on fast-rolling Finnish gravel roads through UNESCO. Closing gaps, responding to attacks, sprinting for position. Train the burn.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Finnish Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Long rides with hard efforts mixed in. Simulates what Finnish Gravel's fast-rolling Finnish gravel roads through UNESCO actually does to you.
At Finnish Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
110 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 110 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Finnish Gravel’s 110 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Finnish Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on fast-rolling finnish gravel roads through unesco geopark to build confidence. Expect: well-maintained gravel roads, forest paths, nordic ski trails.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Durability, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 110 miles of fast-rolling finnish gravel roads through unesco geopark in Lahti, Paijanne Tavastia, Finland.
